instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Killing batteries
threads.message: This board keeps killing batteries. It had some very minor liquid-damage on the LCD connector. Nothing near <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> or the SMC. Diode measurements on the SCL and SDA lines are good at .502 and .500. The battery will work for a while but then lose it's capacity and die. We're on the third one. As soon as we installed the latest one the online diagnostic says that the battery requires service. All four <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> current sense resistors are good. Everything seems very normal there. Not sure where to go next.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Killing batteries
threads.message:
Crappy chinese batteries?

Post <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON levels, w/ and w/o battery connected.
